data.title: Fawlty diaries to fund £12m Cleese divorce
data.meta_description: John Cleese defends the divorce-inspired theme of his show and insists his attacks on his ex-wife are, almost, all in good humour  First he embarked on the Alimony Tour. Now John Cleese is penning
data.text:
John Cleese defends the divorce-inspired theme of his show and insists his attacks on his ex-wife are, almost, all in good humour

First he embarked on the Alimony Tour. Now John Cleese is penning the Maintenance Memoirs to fund the £12.2m divorce from his third wife.

Cleese is set to receive an advance of £1m-£2m for his autobiography. Four leading publishers have already expressed an interest.

The former Monty Python star, who last week started a 36-date one-man tour of Britain, which will earn him a further £1m, is also writing a humorous history book, with the journalist Matthew d’Ancona, called A History of England in Five Minutes.

After his costly 2008 divorce from the American psychoanalyst Alyce Faye Eichelberger, to whom he was married
